sn56.82:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye uccāsayanamahāsayanā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.82:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from high and luxurious beds are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.83:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.83:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving gold and currency are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.84:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye āmakadhaññapaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye āmakadhaññapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.84:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving raw grain are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.85:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye āmakamaṃsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye āmakamaṃsapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.85:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving raw meat are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.86:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye itthikumārikapaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye itthikumārikapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.86:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving women and girls are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.87:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye dāsidāsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye dāsidāsapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.87:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving male and female bondservants are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.88:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye ajeḷakapaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye ajeḷakapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.88:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving goats and sheep are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.89:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye kukkuṭasūkarapaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye kukkuṭasūkarapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.89:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving chickens and pigs are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.9:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, don’t get into arguments, such as:

sn56.9:1.2.pli: ‘na tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāsi, ahaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāmi. Kiṃ tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānissasi. Micchāpaṭipanno tvamasi, ahamasmi sammāpaṭipanno. Sahitaṃ me, asahitaṃ te. Purevacanīyaṃ pacchā avaca, pacchāvacanīyaṃ pure avaca. Adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. Āropito te vādo, cara vādappamokkhāya. Niggahitosi, nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī’ti.
sn56.9:1.2.eng: ‘You don’t understand this teaching and training. I understand this teaching and training. What, you understand this teaching and training? You’re practicing wrong. I’m practicing right. I stay on topic, you don’t. You said last what you should have said first. You said first what you should have said last. What you’ve thought so much about has been disproved. Your doctrine is refuted. Go on, save your doctrine! You’re trapped; get yourself out of this—if you can!’

sn56.9:1.4.pli: Nesā, bhikkhave, kathā atthasaṃhitā nādibrahmacariyakā na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati.
sn56.9:1.4.eng: Because those discussions aren’t beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They don’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

sn56.9:2.1.pli: Kathentā ca kho tumhe, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti katheyyātha, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti katheyyātha, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti katheyyātha, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti katheyyātha …pe…
sn56.9:2.1.eng: When you discuss, you should discuss: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’. …

sn56.9:2.2.eng: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

sn56.90:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye hatthigavassavaḷavapaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye hatthigavassavaḷavapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.90:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving elephants, cows, horses, and mares are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.91:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye khettavatthupaṭiggahaṇā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye khettavatthupaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.91:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from receiving fields and land are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.92:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye kayavikkayā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye kayavikkayā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.92:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from buying and selling are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.93:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye dūteyyapahiṇagamanānuyogā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye dūteyyapahiṇagamanānuyogā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.93:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from running errands and messages are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.94:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye tulākūṭakaṃsakūṭamānakūṭā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye tulākūṭakaṃsakūṭamānakūṭā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.94:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from falsifying weights, metals, or measures are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.95:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā appaṭiviratā …pe….
sn56.95:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from bribery, fraud, cheating, and duplicity are few, while those who don’t refrain are many. …”

sn56.96-101:1.1.pli: … “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye chedanavadhabandhanaviparāmosaālopasahasākārā paṭiviratā; atha kho eteva bahutarā sattā ye chedanavadhabandhanaviparāmosaālopasahasākārā appaṭiviratā.
sn56.96-101:1.1.eng: “… the sentient beings who refrain from mutilation, murder, abduction, banditry, plunder, and violence are few, while those who don’t refrain are many.

sn56.96-101:1.3.eng: It’s because they haven’t seen the four noble truths.

sn56.96-101:1.5.eng: The noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

sn56.96-101:2.1.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
sn56.96-101:2.1.eng: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
